feed.title: NewsTracker: blatter
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Blatter alleges France, Germany tried to influence World Cup hosting decision: report
entry.summary:
In a story published on Sunday, the newspaper Welt am Sonntag quoted Blatter as saying: "Before the World Cup was awarded to Russia and Qatar, there were two political interventions.

Welt am Sonntag quoted Blatter as saying the German football federation, DFB, had "received a recommendation (from Wulff) that Germany should vote for Qatar for economic interests".

entry.title: France and Germany intervened over World Cup votes, says Sepp Blatter
entry.summary:
Blatter said in June that he would stand down as pressure built from the American case and a separate Swiss federal investigation focused on possible money laundering linked to the awarding of the World Cups to Russia and Qatar.

"Is Fifa responsible from the top down for everything in football, what happens in some village somewhere around the world?" asked Blatter, also a target of the American investigation.

entry.title: Blatter: French, German Presidents Tried Influence WCup Vote
entry.summary:
"Messrs Sarkozy and Wulff tried to influence their voting representatives. That's why we now have a World Cup in Qatar. Those who decided it should take responsibility for it," said Blatter, who said he was tired of taking the blame for something he had no control over.

"I act on the leadership principal. If a majority of the executive committee wants a World Cup in Qatar then I have to accept that," Blatter said.

Blatter accepted no responsibly for the plight of migrant laborers building stadiums in Qatar amid reports of human rights abuses.

entry.title: FIFA deflects criticism about absence of Blatter from final
entry.summary: While both organizations raved about the successes of the event, the absence of Blatter and Valcke because of the FIFA corruption investigation lingered.

entry.title: Blatter says he has 'clear conscience' despite FIFA probes
entry.summary:
Four days after being re-elected for a fifth term, Blatter said on June 2 that he would step down amid a crisis provoked by American and Swiss federal investigations of corruption linked to FIFA.

The 79-year-old told Bunte that he happily accepts "fair and constructive criticism, also to consider what can be done differently. But when someone says, 'Blatter is corrupt because FIFA is corrupt', I can only shake my head. Anyone who makes such claims without proof should be jailed."

entry.title: Blatter Not Traveling to Women's World Cup Final in Canada
entry.summary: Traveling to Canada would have taken Blatter to the doorstep of the United States, where he is a target of the investigation into alleged soccer corruption.

entry.title: FIFA's Blatter will not attend Women's World Cup final
entry.summary: FIFA president Sepp Blatter will not travel to Canada for the final of the women's World Cup on July 5 for personal reasons, a U.S.-based lawyer for Blatter said on Tuesday.

entry.title: FIFA election monitor urges Blatter to commit to going
entry.summary: "I call on all concerned - including Mr. Blatter - to endorse in the interest of the reforms unequivocally the announced changing of the guard at the top of FIFA," Scala said.

entry.title: FIFA election monitor urges Blatter to commit to going
entry.summary: Sepp Blatter got a clear message on Sunday from FIFA election monitor Domenico Scala to end speculation he wants to stay in office.

entry.title: Sepp Blatter: 'I Have Not Resigned'
Sport24.co.za | 1000s sign up for Blatter's 'leaving party'
entry.summary: With FIFA mired in a corruption scandal, Blatter, 79, delighted critics this month by announcing he would stand down as president of the governing body and call a leadership election, due between December and February.

entry.title: Thousands sign up for 'leaving party' for FIFA's Blatter
entry.summary: ZURICH A celebration of Sepp Blatter's departure as the head of world soccer's governing body has attracted more than 21,000 would-be guests via Facebook.

entry.title: Insight - The FIFA that Blatter built
entry.summary: Under Blatter, FIFA has handed its development money out strategically.

entry.title: FIFA election chief reminds Blatter of need to step down
entry.summary: Sepp Blatter was warned from within FIFA on Sunday not to attempt to backtrack on his pledge to quit as president.

entry.title: FIFA election chief reminds Blatter of need to step down
entry.summary: ZURICH (AP) " The official overseeing the next FIFA presidential election has reminded Sepp Blatter to stick with his plans to step down.

entry.title: Blatter may seek to stay as FIFA boss, source tells Swiss paper
entry.summary: Blatter's renewed interest in the job was also a reason for the departure of Walter de Gregorio as FIFA's director of communications, since he had argued for a completely new start and advised Blatter to go, the Swiss newspaper said.

entry.title: Blatter may seek to stay as FIFA boss, source tells Swiss paper
entry.summary:
GENEVA (Reuters) - Sepp Blatter may seek to stay on as the president of FIFA, a Swiss newspaper quoted an anonymous source close to Blatter as saying on Sunday.

The Schweiz am Sonntag newspaper said it had information that Blatter had received messages of support from African and Asian football associations, asking him to rethink his decision to step down.

entry.title: EU parliament urges Blatter to quit FIFA immediately
entry.summary:
The European Parliament said Blatter's failure to depart immediately would block efforts to rid FIFA of rampant corruption.

EU politicians heaped pressure on Blatter, 79, voting in favour of an eight-page resolution with a series of demands to clean up football.

He also introduced the news conference where Blatter announced his resignation and appeared close to tears as the departing president announced his exit.

The race to succeed Blatter gathered a new challenger on Wednesday when football great Zico formally declared his candidacy for the FIFA presidency, but the Brazilian admitted his chances of success were limited.

entry.title: FIFA's top spokesman leaves job, Blatter urged to do same
entry.summary: FIFA responded by announcing that its executive committee will meet on July 20 in Zurich to decide when from December to February the election to decide Blatter's successor should be held.

entry.title: FIFA's top spokesman leaves job, Blatter urged to do same
entry.summary: De Gregorio joined FIFA after working on Blatter's campaign team during the 2011 presidential election.

entry.title: EU lawmakers urge FIFA's Blatter to go now
entry.summary: "The European Parliament... therefore calls on FIFA to select, in a transparent and inclusive way, an appropriate interim leader to replace Joseph Blatter forthwith."

entry.title: European lawmakers urge FIFA president Blatter to go now
entry.summary:
STRASBOURG, France (AP) - European lawmakers have urged FIFA President Sepp Blatter to step down immediately, and for an interim leader to be appointed.

FIFA rules require senior vice president Issa Hayatou of Cameroon to step up as interim president if Blatter leaves before the election.

entry.title: FIFA shelves bidding for 2026 World Cup, seeks Blatter replacement
entry.summary: Scandal-plagued FIFA postponed the bidding for the right to host the 2026 World Cup on Wednesday and embarked on the search to find a replacement for outgoing President Sepp Blatter.

entry.title: UEFA President Michel Platini says he won't talk about FIFA
entry.summary: Platini, a former France great and a leading candidate to replace Blatter as FIFA president, spoke Wednesday after meeting with French President Francois Hollande.

entry.title: FIFA to kick off Blatter succession process in July
entry.summary: "This extraordinary Executive Committee will convene in July, the precise date to be confirmed within this week. For this extraordinary elective Congress (to elect Blatter's successor) there are currently various date options for discussion."

entry.title: Sepp Blatter exit date to be decided next month, December departure for Fifa president an option
entry.summary: Fifa has announced the date for the election of Sepp Blatter's successor as president will be decided next month - with December 16 a likely option - and postponed the bidding process for the 2026 World Cup.

entry.title: FIFA said in a statement to The Associated Press on Sunday that sending money to Warner was the idea of the South African government and Blatter was being updated by Mbeki in their discussions.

The newspaper said that in the email, which was not published, Valcke wrote that the $10 million was "based on discussions between FIFA and the South African government, and also between our President (Blatter) and President Thabo Mbeki."
